btPolarDecomposition Class Reference

Detailed Description

This class is used to compute the polar decomposition of a matrix. In general, the polar decomposition factorizes a matrix, A, into two parts: a unitary matrix (U) and a positive, semi-definite Hermitian matrix (H). However, in this particular implementation the original matrix, A, is required to be a square 3x3 matrix with real elements. This means that U will be an orthogonal matrix and H with be a positive-definite, symmetric matrix.

Member Function Documentation

unsigned int btPolarDecomposition::decompose ( const btMatrix3x3 &  a,
btMatrix3x3 &  u,
btMatrix3x3 &  h 
) const

Decomposes a matrix into orthogonal and symmetric, positive-definite parts. If the number of iterations returned by this function is equal to the maximum number of iterations, the algorithm has failed to converge.

Parameters:
a - the original matrix
u - the resulting orthogonal matrix
h - the resulting symmetric matrix
Returns:
the number of iterations performed by the algorithm.

00042 {
00043   // Use the 'u' and 'h' matrices for intermediate calculations
00044   u = a;
00045   h = a.inverse();
00046 
00047   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_maxIterations; ++i)
00048   {
00049     const btScalar h_1 = p1_norm(h);
00050     const btScalar h_inf = pinf_norm(h);
00051     const btScalar u_1 = p1_norm(u);
00052     const btScalar u_inf = pinf_norm(u);
00053 
00054     const btScalar h_norm = h_1 * h_inf;
00055     const btScalar u_norm = u_1 * u_inf;
00056 
00057     // The matrix is effectively singular so we cannot invert it
00058     if (btFuzzyZero(h_norm) || btFuzzyZero(u_norm))
00059       break;
00060 
00061     const btScalar gamma = btPow(h_norm / u_norm, 0.25f);
00062     const btScalar inv_gamma = btScalar(1.0) / gamma;
00063 
00064     // Determine the delta to 'u'
00065     const btMatrix3x3 delta = (u * (gamma - btScalar(2.0)) + h.transpose() * inv_gamma) * btScalar(0.5);
00066 
00067     // Update the matrices
00068     u += delta;
00069     h = u.inverse();
00070 
00071     // Check for convergence
00072     if (p1_norm(delta) <= m_tolerance * u_1)
00073     {
00074       h = u.transpose() * a;
00075       h = (h + h.transpose()) * 0.5;
00076       return i;
00077     }
00078   }
00079 
00080   // The algorithm has failed to converge to the specified tolerance, but we
00081   // want to make sure that the matrices returned are in the right form.
00082   h = u.transpose() * a;
00083   h = (h + h.transpose()) * 0.5;
00084 
00085   return m_maxIterations;
00086 }
